data.text: @SecretTeacherAu @watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster @watinthe Trolling?  You really shouldn’t use words that you don’t understand.  And you haven’t read, or understood, my response.  Or indeed my original post, which was not asking another to “do my research “, just pointing out the article posted did not support their position.

@GarethSage @watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster @watinthe That only applies to people who treat others like that in the first place. Hate to see trolling, and will stand up others when 'people' can't be bothered to do their own research. It's another form of insidious harassment.

@SecretTeacherAu @watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster @watinthe The article was posted in support of an argument that Covid had long term effects in children.  Which it clearly didn’t support.  I was not asking for more evidence, merely critiquing that provided. For a teacher your comprehension skills need a little work.

@GarethSage @watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster Do your own research. I'm paid to do mine so go find the peer reviewed articles yourself. If you would like to pay @watinthe for the time?  They are there if you could be bothered to look. #lazy

@watinthe_ I marked the roll one day, yr 7-12 : 
6 lessons 
In all of them, 5 students away, out of 20/25
 due to ‘pandemic’. 
In all classes
@watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster That may be so.  But please show me where the article deals with long Covid in kids.
@watinthe_ @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster Where does the article say there are 120k kids with long Covid?

@christafarius In January it was the 20-29 year age group who were out in pubs and clubs. When schools first went back, it was primary aged kids as they weren’t in masks. Now high schools have removed masks it’s hit older kids. Also looks like kids taking it home to their parents

@GarethSage @aussieavidread @derekchaimedia @AugersMonster Kids under 5 aren’t vaccinated. Less than 50% kids 5-11 have had 1 dose, very few have had a 2nd, won’t be eligible until later this month. Kids 12-15 not eligible for booster. Most kids over 16 need a booster and are yet to have one.
